titles.title: A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the Emergency Medical Services for Children program.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

calendar.text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. Reported by Senator Alexander without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 695.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary:
Emergency Medical Services for Children Program Reauthorization Act of 2018
This bill reauthorizes through FY2024 the Emergency Medical Services for Children grant program. The program is administered by the Health Resources and Services Administration and focuses on improving emergency health care for children who are seriously ill or injured.
